summary:
I am a newly graduated lawyer and aspiring researcher how recently moved from Brazil to the Netherlands. 

In the past years, as an undergraduate student, I have worked as an intern in several places and had the opportunity to get in touch with different legal areas and careers. I developed a keen interest in philosophy and politics - an interest that reflected in the courses and extracurricular activities I choose to attend as an student, as you can see at the "Projects" section. 

My previous job experience and the other activities I have engaged in helped me develop key skills such as public speaking, how to deals with time sensible tasks, group work and co-operation, organisation of academic events and academic/legal writing.

Studying and doing research in philosophy and politics are endeavours I intent to engage more in the future. In this regard, I recently started a new Bachelor in Philosophy of a Specific Discipline at the Erasmus University Rotterdam (sep. 2022 - aug. 2025). I will follow the Bachelor in Philosophy of Law course as my complementary study.

As a brazilian/italian currently living in the Netherlands, I am in searching for opportunities to expand my worldview, and at same time share my own life and academic experiences with others.

projects: [{'title': 'Tutorial Education Programme', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'Member of the Tutorial Education Programme of Law School of Federal University of Paraná (PET Direito UFPR), under the tutorship of Professor Heloisa Fernandes Camara. I was a voluteer member during 2020, and a scholarship holder between 2021 and 2022. The program is developed by groups of students, with mentoring by a faculty member, and it is guided by the principle of inseparability between teaching, research and expanded learning. Since I joined the group, we have developed activities under the following topics: Past, Law, and future (2020); The crossroads of Brazilian legal subjectivity from a southern point of view (2021); Law, art and inequality (2022).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Heloísa', 'last_name': 'Nerone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Brazilian lawyer and philosophy student'}]}, {'title': 'Undergraduate Research Project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'Volunteer member of the undergraduate research project “Legal form and social spaces of cooperation in Latin American dependent capitalism”, under the supervision/orientation of Professor Ricardo Prestes Pazello, in the Legal Sciences Sector of Federal University of Paraná. \nBetween 2020 and 2021, I developed a research entitled “Reproductive work and the overexploitation of female labor power: dialogues between the theory of consubstantiality and the Marxist theory of dependency” (in Portuguese). In the following year, I partially developed a research entitled “The land issue in Brazil as an expression of the dependent legal relationship: deindustrialisation, reprimarisation and land spoiling” (in Portuguese).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Heloísa', 'last_name': 'Nerone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Brazilian lawyer and philosophy student'}]}, {'title': 'Expanded Learning Project', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Voluntary participation in the “Collective Judicial Proceedings Observatory” project, coordinated by Professor Sérgio Cruz Arenhart and promoted by the Center for Legal Practice of the Legal Sciences Sector of Federal University of Paraná. The project’s main objective is to monitor and evaluate national collective lawsuits and learn from the procedural techniques used.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Heloísa', 'last_name': 'Nerone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Brazilian lawyer and philosophy student'}]}, {'title': 'Initiation to Teaching Programme', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Scholarship holder (during 2017) and  volunteer member ( during 2018) of the Initiation to Teaching Programme in the “Methodology of Scientific Work in Law” course, taught by Professor Angela Couto Machado Fonseca, in the Legal Sciences Sector of Federal University of Paraná (UFPR).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Heloísa', 'last_name': 'Nerone', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Brazilian lawyer and philosophy student'}]}]
